entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
Let's talk about starting using *Make TXT Site*.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Dependencies - 0x03 Bootstrap - 0x03.00 Download - 0x03.01 Configure - 0x04 Templates - 0x04.00 Files - 0x04.01 Variables - 0x05 Posts - 0x05 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Dependencies ]]------------------------------------------------------
*Make TXT Site* only use simple and common tools in a GNU/*nix environment.
Here is a comprehensive list of tools used:
- bash - cat - cut - date - find - gpg - grep - head - make - make - sed - sort - tail - tree
---[[ 0x03 Bootstrap ]]---------------------------------------------------------
You need to get the project locally and change some variables content to get start.
------[[ 0x03.00 Download ]]----------------------------------------------------
You can use git:
``` git clone https://github.com/gildasio/make-txt-site ```
Or download a zip file:
``` wget https://github.com/gildasio/make-txt-site/archive/master.zip ```
------[[ 0x03.01 Configure Variables ]]-----------------------------------------
Edit `Makefile` change init variables values.
Variables for general purpose:
- `PREFIX`: Directory where txt content files are in. `public` for example to use in Gitlab Pages more easily - `PUBLIC_INDEX`: Name file (without extension) of public index page. It will be used to generate `PUBLIC_INDEX.txt` and `PUBLIC_INDEX.html` files - `HIDDEN_INDEX`: Name file (without extension) of hidden index page. It will be used to generate `HIDDEN_INDEX.txt` and `HIDDEN_INDEX.html` files - `HIDDEN_PATTERN`: Some pattern to *Make TXT Site* identify if a file is a public post or a hidden one
Variables to use only in Atom feed:
- `URL`: URL of your site. Remember to escape / using \ - `AUTHOR`: Your name my fellow - `SITE`: Site name
---[[ 0x04 Templates ]]---------------------------------------------------------
After configure init variables you have to configure some templates that is in `template` directory.
------[[ 0x04.00 Files ]]-------------------------------------------------------
- `post.txt`: Template used by `make post ` as a post skel
- `index.txt` and `index.html`: Have to match with `PUBLIC_INDEX` variable in `Makefile`. If you change there you have to change here too.
- `priv.txt` and `priv.html`: Have to match with `HIDDEN_INDEX` variable in `Makefile`. If you change there you have to change here too.
------[[ 0x04.01 Variables ]]---------------------------------------------------
In `post.txt` template you can put `{{date}}` anywhere in content and when run `make post ` it will be replaced by today date.
In indexes templates you have to put `{{content}}` somewhere to be replaced by a file lists, as a `tree` output.
---[[ 0x05 Posts ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
After configure your project (variables and templates) you are ok to go and create posts.
You can run `make post ` and a filename named will be created in `PREFIX` (defualt: `public`) directory as an instance of `post.txt` template and will open it in your `$EDITOR`.
Otherwise you can simple create a txt file inside `PREFIX` directory and edit it as well.
After that, run `make all` to create all files.

entry.title: 0x01-features/hidden-posts.txt
entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
I know there are texts you don't want to be made public, me too. Because of that, *Make TXT Site* provide this feature.
I will explain how to use hidden posts feature in *Make TXT Site*.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Hidden Posts Feature - 0x03 Example - 0x04 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Hidden Posts Feature ]]----------------------------------------------
First of all you must have configured some variables in `Makefile`, as discussed in `/0x00-starting.txt`, they are:
- `HIDDEN_INDEX` - `HIDDEN_PATTERN`
These variables are used to create the hidden posts lists and exclude hidden posts from normal public index.
For example if you `HIDDEN_PATTERN` is `priv_` so create posts following that pattern in posts directory and they will be treated as hidden posts:
- public/priv_example.txt - public/priv_secret.txt
These posts will not be listed in normal public index but in hidden index as well.
---[[ 0x03 Example ]]-----------------------------------------------------------
This is a hidden post:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/priv_example.txt
And it isn't listed in public index:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/index.txt
But in hidden index:
- https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site/priv.txt

entry.title: 0x02-tips/gitlab-pages.txt
entry.content:
_____ _ _____ __ __ _____ _____ _ _ | |___| |_ ___ |_ _| | |_ _| | __|_| |_ ___ | | | | .'| '_| -_| | | |- -| | | |__ | | _| -_| |_|_|_|__,|_,_|___| |_| |__|__| |_| |_____|_|_| |___|
by Gildásio Júnior https://gildasio.gitlab.io/make-txt-site
---[[ 0x00 Intro ]]-------------------------------------------------------------
Sites made by *Make TXT Site* are simple to be hosted. Gitlab pages is a great way to do that.
---[[ 0x01 ToC ]]---------------------------------------------------------------
- 0x00 Intro - 0x01 ToC - 0x02 Gitlab Pages - 0x03 Signature
---[[ 0x02 Gitlab Pages ]]------------------------------------------------------
All you need is to create a `.gitlab-ci.yml` file in root directory. A example content to this file:
